info.title: Pet Store
info.description: Manage pets, orders, purchases, users, and other operations in the pet shop.

id.description: The unique identifier for the pet.

get.description: Logout the currently logged in user.

post.description:
### Key Features

- **Free and public:** No API key or authentication required.
- **GraphQL Schema:** Explore relationships between countries, continents, and languages easily.
- **Use cases:** Testing GraphQL clients, learning schema navigation, building demos, etc.

---
### Usage Instructions  
In the "success" debug base under this endpoint, you can directly make requests to the GraphQL API.
- The query field has already been filled out.
- Click the refresh button next to "Schema fetched" to fetch the schema.
- Click send to directly send the request and receive a response.
---

### Endpoint

**GraphQL Endpoint:**  
```
https://countries.trevorblades.com/
```

---

### Main Schema Objects

- **Country**
  - Fields: `code`, `name`, `native` (native name), `phone` (country calling code), `continent`, `capital`, `currency`, `languages`, `emoji`, etc.
  
- **Continent**
  - Fields: `code`, `name`, `countries` (list of countries in the continent)
  
- **Language**
  - Fields: `code`, `name`, `native` (native name)
  
---

### Example Queries

**Get all countries with their code and name:**
```graphql
{
  countries {
    code
    name
  }
}
```

**Get details of a single country:**
```graphql
{
  country(code: "JP") {
    name
    capital
    currency
    languages {
      name
    }
  }
}
```

**List all continents and the countries in each:**
```graphql
{
  continents {
    name
    countries {
      name
      code
    }
  }
}
```

---

### How to Use

- You can access the API via your own GraphQL client, curl, or visit the [GraphQL Explorer for Countries API](https://countries.trevorblades.com/) in your browser.
- Supports introspection, so you can see the full schema and documentation directly in the GraphQL Playground.

---

### Common Use-Cases

- **Frontend prototyping:** For dropdowns (countries, continents, etc.)
- **Demo apps:** Populate select inputs without backend work.
- **GraphQL learning:** Practice writing queries and navigating relationships with real data.
When you connect to the server using the POST method, an SSE connection will be automatically established, and the server will send the current time every second.

Add two integers from the request and return the result in the response.
The service is provided by DneOnline.

Pet.description: Information about an animal in the pet store.

photoUrls.description: List of photo URLs for the pet.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment. This will be a unique identifier for the payment, and is used to reference the payment in other objects.

amount.description: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive decimal figure describing the amount to be collected.

source.description: The payment source to take the payment from. This can be a card or a bank account. Some of these properties will be hidden on read to protect PII leaking.

oneOf.title: Card
oneOf.description: A card (debit or credit) to take payment from.

name.description: Cardholder's full name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The card number, as a string without separators (masked on read).

cvc.description: Card security code, 3 or 4 digits usually on the back.

exp_month.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

exp_year.description: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

address_line1.description: Address line 1 for the billing address.

address_line2.description: Address line 2 for the billing address.

address_country.description: Country of the billing address (2-letter code).

oneOf.title: Bank Account
oneOf.description: A bank account to take payment from. Must accept the payment currency.

number.description: The account number for the bank account (string).

sort_code.description: The sort code for the bank account (string; 6 digits).

account_type.description: The type of entity that holds the account.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank associated with the routing number.

status.description: The status of the payment, one of `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`.

Links-Order.description: The link to the order resource.

Order.description: Details of an order for a pet.

petId.description: Identifier for the pet being ordered.

shipDate.description: Estimated ship date of the order.

complete.description: Indicates whether the order is complete.

type.description: Type or category of the response.

detail.example: The request is invalid or missing required parameters.

value.detail: The request is invalid or missing required parameters.

value.title: Unauthorized
value.detail: You do not have the necessary permissions.

detail.example: Access is forbidden with the provided credentials.

value.title: Forbidden
value.detail: Access is forbidden with the provided credentials.

detail.example: The specified resource does not exist.

value.title: Not Found
value.detail: The specified resource does not exist.

detail.example: You have exceeded the rate limit.

value.title: Too Many Requests
